data.chText: 素描；速写；草图
data.enText: a simple picture that is drawn quickly and does not have many details

data.chText: 画家正为他的下一幅作品画素描。
data.enText: The artist is making sketches for his next painting.

data.chText: 她画了一幅这个地区的略图，用来给我们指路。
data.enText: She drew a sketch map of the area to show us the way.

data.chText: 幽默短剧；小品
data.enText: a short funny scene on television, in the theatre, etc.

data.chText: 剧社上演了一出夫妻二人买新车的短剧。
data.enText: The drama group did a sketch about a couple buying a new car.

data.chText: 简报；速写；概述
data.enText: a short report or story that gives only basic details about sth

data.chText: 首相生平简介
data.enText: a biographical sketch of the Prime Minister

data.chText: 画素描；画速写
data.enText: to make a quick drawing of sb/sth

data.chText: 他很快勾勒出了窗外的风景。
data.enText: He quickly sketched the view from the window.

data.chText: 概述；简述
data.enText: to give a general description of sth, giving only the basic facts

data.chText: 她简要叙述了解决问题的计划。
data.enText: She sketched out her plan for tackling the problem.
sketch sth↔in

data.chText: 补充说明；给…补充细节
data.enText: to give more information or details about sth

data.text: picture ♦ drawing ♦ painting ♦ portrait ♦ illustration ♦ sketch ♦ image

data.chText: 以上各词均表示图画、绘画。
data.enText: These are all words for a scene, person or thing that has been represented on paper by drawing, painting, etc.
picture

data.chText: 指用铅笔、钢笔或颜料画出的图画、绘画：
data.enText: a scene, person or thing that has been represented on paper using a pencil, a pen or paint

data.chText: 孩子在画他们的宠物。
data.enText: The children were drawing pictures of their pets.
drawing

data.chText: 指用铅笔或钢笔而非颜料画出的图画、素描画：
data.enText: a picture that has been made using a pencil or pen, not paint

data.chText: 铅笔／木炭画
data.enText: a pencil/charcoal drawing
painting

data.chText: 指用颜料画出的图画、绘画：
data.enText: a picture that has been made using paint

data.chText: 美国艺术家的绘画作品集
data.enText: a collection of paintings by American artists
portrait

data.chText: 指肖像、半身画像、半身照：
data.enText: a painting, drawing or photograph of a person, especially of the head and shoulders

data.chText: 弗美尔的“艺术家在画室的肖像”
data.enText: Vermeer's ‘Portrait of the artist in his studio’

data.chText: 自画像
data.enText: a self-portrait (= a painting that you do of yourself)
illustration

data.chText: 指书或杂志中的插图、图表：
data.enText: a picture in a book or magazine, especially one that shows or explains sth

data.chText: 见166页上的插图。
data.enText: See illustration on p.166.
sketch

data.chText: 指素描、速写、草图：
data.enText: a simple picture that is drawn quickly and does not have many details

data.chText: 我开始作画之前通常要画几幅草图。
data.enText: I usually do a few very rough sketches before I start on a painting.
image

data.chText: 指画像、雕像、塑像：
data.enText: a copy of sb/sth in the form of a picture or statue

data.chText: 洞穴壁上装饰着鹿和猎人的画像。
data.enText: Images of deer and hunters decorate the cave walls.

data.chText: 用picture还是image？
image可指雕像、塑像；picture总是指平面图画。picture可指风景画；image总是指人或事物的画像、雕像。image较正式，较不常用。
data.enText: An image can be a statue; a picture is always two-dimensional (= flat) . A picture can show a scene; an image is always of a person or thing. Image is more formal and much less frequent.
picture or image?
sketch sth↔in

data.chText: 补充说明；给…补充细节
data.enText: to give more information or details about sth

example: he made several studies before starting to paint

tr: a humorous or satirical drawing published in a newspaper or magazine
describe roughly or briefly or give the main points or summary of
example: sketch the outline of the book

value.def: A sketch is a drawing that is done quickly without a lot of details. Artists often use sketches as a preparation for a more detailed painting or drawing.

example.ex: ...a sketch of a soldier by Orpen.
example.tran: 奥彭所画的一幅士兵素描

value.def: If you sketch something, you make a quick, rough drawing of it.

example.ex: Clare and David Astor are sketching a view of far Spanish hills...
example.tran: 克莱尔和戴维·阿斯特正在画远处西班牙山峦的风景素描。

example.ex: I always sketch with pen and paper.
example.tran: 我总是用钢笔和纸画素描。

example.ex: ...balconies and gates sketched on holidays in Spain and Italy...
example.tran: 在西班牙和意大利度假时画的以阳台和大门为主题的素描画

example.ex: Her hobbies were playing the guitar and sketching.
example.tran: 她爱好弹吉他和画素描。

value.def: A sketch of a situation, person, or incident is a brief description of it without many details.

example.ex: ...thumbnail sketches of heads of state and political figures...
example.tran: 对国家元首和政治人物的简略叙述

example.ex: I had a basic sketch of a plan.
example.tran: 我有一个基本的计划框架。

value.def: If you sketch a situation or incident, you give a short description of it, including only the most important facts.

example.ex: Cross sketched the story briefly, telling the facts just as they had happened.
example.tran: 克罗斯简要地叙述了事情的经过，把当时发生的情况一五一十地说了一遍。

example.ex: Luxembourg sketched out an acceptable compromise between Britain, France and Germany.
example.tran: 卢森堡草拟了一项英国、法国和德国之间都可以接受的妥协方案。

value.def: A sketch is a short humorous piece of acting, usually forming part of a comedy show.

example.ex: ...a five-minute sketch about a folk singer.
example.tran: 刻画一位民歌手的 5 分钟幽默短剧

value.tran: (通常指喜剧节目中的)幽默短剧
